Work Location: In person

title: ASSISTANT DIRECTOR – GRADE SCHOOL PROGRAM AND EXPLORATION CAMP
description:
JCC MetroWest, West Orange, NJ 07052 – Full Time 40 hours


If making an impact in the lives of grade school-aged children and their families appeals to you, the JCC MetroWest’s Kids Club (after school program) and Exploration Camp (summer program) is seeking a mindful, collaborative, detail-oriented individual with excellent communication skills for the newly created Assistant Director role. Reporting to the Director of the Grade School Program and Exploration Camp, the Assistant Director provides high level administrative support and customer service and administrative support, handling diverse responsibilities including financial tracking, scheduling, calendar maintenance, supply & materials ordering, communications with local elementary schools/religious schools and school boards as well as with parents and other departments and programs at JCC MetroWest. The ideal individual is expected to demonstrate a strong work ethic, initiative, foresight and follow-through, positive attitude, accountability, and the ability to understand how Kids Club and Exploration Camp relate to other programs at JCC MetroWest in order to maximize opportunities.

**RESPONSIBILITIES/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:**


Responsibilities include a broad variety of administrative tasks, working closely with the Director, participant families, Kids Club and Exploration Camp staff, and internal and external partners to maintain efficient and effective information, processes and procedures. The Assistant Director must have strong organizational skills that reflect his/her ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly, with excellent attention to detail. Essential functions of the role include, but are not limited to:

* Maintain state and licensing requirements for staff and students
* Collaboratively provide daily oversight of staff schedule, ensuring that ratios are met and that there is sufficient bus staff
* Communicate effectively, consistently and systematically with team members, other departments, and internal and external partners and engage in collaborative conversations that support the department  

Collaborate to annually develop and then independently maintain a calendar for school year and summer programs, incorporating holidays, school closings, enrichment classes, summer camp, and special events (e.g., camp photos)
* Respond to emails and phone messages in a timely manner
* Ride a bus and pick up students as needed and occasionally stay in a classroom if needed
* Input and maintain participant data in databases and filing systems including Spectrum, Camp Minder and FileMaker
* Input and maintain records of staff members
* Work collaboratively with elementary schools, Hebrew schools and three board of education departments
* Opening and closing responsibilities for the department
* Purchase supplies, snacks and challah for department programs
* Keep staff and JCC departments updated with a monthly email of department changes, half days, and special activities
* Provide staff support for children presenting challenges in the classroom, as needed
* Be the second JCC staff member on occasional disciplinary meetings with parents
* Complete all professional development hours and state training requirements

 **OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:**

* Develop schedules for outdoor space, indoor play spaces, special events and programs
* Ensure that rooms are reserved and set up for programs
* Attend Agency, Operations and Department meetings; participate in department and Agency activities
	+ Occasionally submit payroll
* Submit marketing and maintenance requests as needed
* Maintain staff and bus attendance records/binders
* Takeout daily snacks for classrooms
* Help setup for Shabbat on Fridays
* Provide assistance to staff members as needed
* Other duties as assigned

 **PHYSICAL & OTHER REQUIREMENTS:**

* May require long periods of standing or sitting
* Although largely an office position, position also requires bus rides to pick up students as needed and occasional stays in classrooms with students
* Moderate use of computer terminal screen right or left hand use, typing
* Evening / off-hours availability as needed for meetings and events
* Experience and ability to adapt to new software program and systems
* Knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook
* College Degree and/or 2+ years relevant experience

***Qualified candidates should email a cover letter and resume to the attention of Dianne Lucas, Grade School Program Director and Exploration Camp Director, at*** ***dlucas@jccmetrowest.org******.***

*All applicants for employment shall be considered without regard to race, religion, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, age, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.*

**Agency Information:**


JCC MetroWest has been at the center of our community for 143 years, bringing people together while providing educational, social, cultural and fitness programs. Here at the J, we take every precaution to keep our community safe and healthy, as well as warm, inclusive, and welcoming.

title: Family Nurse Practitioner

We are seeking a dedicated Family Nurse Practitioner to join our healthcare team. The ideal candidate will provide primary healthcare services to patients of all ages, focusing on family-centered care and promoting overall wellness.

- Experience in pediatric care, including PICU and neonatal ventilator management  
- Proficiency in acute care management, acute pain management, and family planning services

Joining our team offers the opportunity to work in a collaborative healthcare environment that values patient-centered care. We provide competitive compensation, benefits packages, and opportunities for professional growth. title: Marketing Insights Manager, Commercial
description:
Job Description:
Introduction
At GAF, we cover more than buildings. We cover each other. No matter what role, tenure, or track, under this roof you are empowered to be there for your teammates, your customers, and especially your community. Under this roof, we don’t back down from hard work– we support one another in pursuit of something bigger. We define the future while leading the present. And under this roof, we own our opportunities. Becoming the market leader only happens when everyone feels they have the opportunity, and the support, to thrive. We are GAF. And under this roof, we protect what matters most.
Team Overview
The Insights Team is a world class research function dedicated to advocating for GAF’s customers, identifying customer needs and pain points while supporting insights driven customer led innovation across GAF’s products and experiences. We are strategic business partners who strive to uncover, deliver and evangelize actionable insights to drive product/program strategy, design and experience.
Summary
The Marketing Insights Manager - Commercial plays an integral role in establishing GAF as the leader in Commercial roofing by building a clear connection to customer needs and empowering the organization to make customer led strategic business decisions. Reporting to the Sr. Director Marketing Insights, this position has end to end accountability for the successful delivery of the Commercial Market Insights roadmap within GAF’s Marketing Organization. This highly visible role within the organization leads and drives the Commercial insights and research agenda, managing cross functional projects and stakeholders across Product Marketing, Sales, Building & Roofing Science and R&D to deliver meaningful insights and recommendations to guide successful customer driven strategies, tactics, product development and experiences. The ideal candidate will act with integrity and back-bone, make thoughtful recommendations sifting through wants to deliver upon needs, engage in healthy debate and challenge the status quo across all levels of management, including executive leadership to ensure the customer is at the center of decision making.
The Marketing Insights Manager provides expertise and strategic partnership in the development and execution of Voice of the Customer and Market Research initiatives which drive GAF’s and Siplast’s Commercial Marketing and Innovation strategies. This role will directly impact product, brand and program development by uncovering and evangelizing actionable and meaningful insights through a combination of research methodologies.
The primary responsibility of this position is to lead, plan, manage, execute and successfully deliver multiple insights projects of varying size and complexity.
This player-coach will own day to day execution responsibilities while managing a team of analysts to successfully build and accomplish an aggressive Commercial insights/research roadmap. A successful candidate brings deep business and industry experience, product knowledge and business acumen to the role and is a passionate champion for the voice of customers (e.g. contractors, architects, specifiers and building owners), with strengths in analytics and synthesizing insights into compelling narratives to ensure GAF allocates resources towards the market/customer needs that best support business goals.
Essential Duties
Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:* Serve as the in-house Commercial insights expert. Delivers insights knowledge, strategic recommendations and agile approaches to solve business questions and challenges as they arise from Commercial stakeholders across the organization.


Research Strategy & Execution* Owns the Commercial Insights research roadmap. Partners with stakeholders to define research/insights needs, anticipating needs as changes in the business/market arise. Manages the initial development, ongoing alignment and socialization of the evolving plan with key stakeholders across the business. Manages internal business owners and stakeholders to articulate and define insights needed to solidify the Research Roadmap and to secure resources (both internal and external) in support of business needs.
* Commercial strategic business partner and point person for new product development (NPD) and enterprise priority initiatives. Provides insights thought leadership on NPD cross functional teams and owns the insights strategy in support of successful product development, optimization and business outcomes keeping the customer at the center.
* Leads, facilitates and curates internal and external cross functional in-person insights engagements including workshops, focus groups, co-creation and brainstorming sessions. In partnership with Building & Roofing Science (BRS), R&D, Product Marketing and Sales owns the end to end management, execution and delivery (from agenda, methodology, facilitation to insights dissemination) of impactful insights led engagements that provide insight into challenging business questions, gaps in the market/customer experience and product development opportunities while bringing customer needs to light to drive action.
* Insights project management and resource planning. Plans, manages, and delivers Marketing Insights projects. Manages and executes end-to-end research projects, including requirement gathering, defining research approach/methodology, participant recruitment, and questionnaire/discussion guide development to meet the insights needs of the business.
* Oversees agency partners/outside vendors. Conduct Commercial market research projects through third parties if additional resources are required OR an outside perspective is needed. Manage requirements, resources, budget and internal stakeholders throughout the process.


Research Enablement & Technology Ownership* Owner of several Insights tools/systems. Owns the management, administration and strategic execution of key Insights systems including Workfront and Aurelius.
* Owns the relationships with several secondary insights resources. Manage the licenses, users, data dissemination, onboarding/education and the annual pricing negotiation process in partnership with procurement.
* Creates and institutionalizes insights project management methodologies, approaches and standard operating procedures. Collaborates across the insights team to ensure standardization across the function, ease of onboarding new talent and a consistent high level of experience with constant improvement in mind.
* Manages a team of 2 contractors/analysts to support aggressive research agenda.


Under This Roof, We Require* 7+ years of related experience in marketing analytics, marketing research, user experience research or management consulting.
* A Bachelor’s Degree/MBA or advanced degree preferred
* Experience with quantitative research (survey design, response effects, sampling, crosstabs, and statistical concepts, etc.) and qualitative/user-centered design methods (individual and group interviews, diary studies, direct observation, think-aloud usability testing, etc.) (advanced).
* Experience with a broad range of Marketing Research tools/technology including Qualtrics, Usertesting.com and other online insights tools (advanced).
* Experience with Excel (advanced), PowerPoint (advanced), and Word (advanced)
* Experience working in the Building Materials space. Experience in adjacent complex industries/product categories will be considered.
* Expert facilitation/moderation skills are required.
* Strong stakeholder management and relationship building skills.


Under This Roof, We Also Value* Marketing Research, Customer Experience and User Experience Research certifications preferred.
* A Bachelor’s Degree/MBA focused in Statistics, Research, Psychology, Cognitive Science, Anthropology, Human Factors, HCI/CS, Marketing, General Management, Architecture, Sustainability or Engineering is a plus.
* Excellent communicator (both written and verbal) with strong business acumen and strong work ethic.
* Demonstrated project management skills and ability to effectively manage a large workload with ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Experience conducting analysis and sharing actionable insights (advanced).
* Experience working with and managing research service providers.


How We Protect What Matters Most* We offer a wide range of health insurance options that include medical, dental, and vision for you and your family.
* Our Family-Building benefits support the many different journeys to fertility and parenthood.
* Our robust 401K plan includes an employer match contribution with your pre-tax and/or Roth contributions.
* Other exciting programs and perks are available to help employees achieve work-life balance, including (but not limited to) a wellness program, free financial coaching, a referral program, and product rebates when purchased for an employee’s primary residence.
* Professional growth and development are very important to us! We offer internal training programs and courses, as well as a generous tuition reimbursement program.
* We put diversity and inclusion into action with our Employee Resource Groups, which unite employees based on common perspectives, identities, demographic factors, or out of a desire to be an ally.

GAF complies with federal, state, and local disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If a reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact HR Services at 833-HR-XPERT.
We believe our employees are our greatest resource. We offer competitive salary, benefits, 401k, and vacation packages for all full time permanent positions. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and GAF, Standard Logistics, SGI, and Siplast are proud to be affirmative action employers. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. If applying for positions in the U.S., must be eligible to work in the U.S. without need for employer sponsored visa (work permit).

description:

title: Youth Mentor
description:
Do you want to mentor high-needs teens/young adults and help them plan for the future? Do you want to provide community service, while gaining invaluable experience? Become an AmeriCorps Member at St. Nicks Alliance.

**About St. Nicks Alliance**

St. Nicks Alliance (SNA) is a nonprofit, nonsectarian community-based organization founded in 1975 with the mission to transform lives of low- and moderate-income people through employment, education, housing, and health care. St. Nicks Alliance’s Youth and Education serves more than 6,000 North Brooklyn youth each year. Through a wide-range of programs, children and youth are empowered to successfully advance through the stages of education and into young adulthood with the core competencies to thrive. St. Nicks Alliance’s holistic approach combines youth development, academic enrichment, health and wellness, arts learning and post-secondary readiness.

**About St. Nicks Alliance AmeriCorps Program**

SNA launched its AmeriCorps New York service program in 2019. AmeriCorps is focused on the good acts of Community Service and is funded, in part by, a grant from the Corporation for National and Community Service (CNCS).

St. Nicks Alliance AmeriCorps Members serve as Youth Success Mentors who play a pivotal role in the lives of 500 high-needs youth, ages 12-24. AmeriCorps members are placed at five high schools, three middle schools, and the SNA Workforce Development Center in Brooklyn’s Williamsburg and Bushwick neighborhoods where only 44% of adults have high school diplomas and unemployment for young adults is 18%. Through mentorship, AmeriCorps members help youth to complete high school or vocational training, prepare for graduation, and transition into the workforce or college.

Full-time AmeriCorps Members serve 1700 hours over 12 months, typically 5 days/week, 35 hours per week. Part-time AmeriCorps members have a modified schedule, serving 900 hours over 6-12 months. Based on hours of service, AmeriCorps members receive a living allowance and a Segal Education Award to pay for college expenses, and in some cases, the college expenses of their children or grandchildren. Members will receive training prior to their placement and during their service year in order to successfully meet their service responsibilities.

**AmeriCorps Youth Success Mentors Duties and Responsibilities**

● Mentor and assist with the administration of a student caseload through regular check-ins, coaching and other support. Students may be struggling with attendance, credit accumulation, workforce readiness, internships or vocational training

● Assist students with post-secondary planning, i.e. individual career planning, college and financial applications, creating resumes or applying for employment.

● Support socio-emotional and academic growth by helping to co-facilitate advisories and clubs

● Assist students to make a successful transition after middle school, high school or vocational training

● Research educational and employment opportunities and share with the graduating cohort, specifically in their communities.

● Communicate regularly with Task Supervisor to support student success·

● Help develop an Alumni Group through outreach.

● Help plan and implement service days, some may be on national holidays.

● Complete related assignments to support the success of teens and young adults

Must Have Core Competencies, Knowledge, Skills and Education

● Be at least 18 years old. ● Be a U.S. Citizen, U.S. National, or lawful permanent resident.

● Have a high school diploma.

● Be subject to and pass criminal history checks.

● Be able to serve approximately 20-35 hours/week.

● Be able to accrue 1700 service hours (FT) or half-time (900) during the term of service.

● Have the ability to relate to students from a variety of backgrounds and abilities.

● Have strong verbal and written communication skills.

● Bilingual (English/Spanish) is a plus

How to Apply Qualified candidates should submit a cover letter and resume to youthresumes@stnicksalliance.org with “Americorps Youth Success Mentor” in the subject line.

Please note: This is an Americorps Service position and all applicants will also need to apply for and be accepted to the AmeriCorps program. Placement is conditional upon acceptance into the AmeriCorps program and background check completion. More information about the Americorps program can be found here: http://www.nycservice.org/initiatives/45

**AmeriCorps Service Member Benefits:** 

● Living allowance for AmeriCorps service, as below. ● Segal Education Award, upon successful completion of AmeriCorps service hours (valid for educational expenses, for up to 7 years)

**Living Allowance Chart**

**Service Term**

**Full time** 

**Hours - 1700**

**SNA Living Allowance -$24,650** 

**Segal Education Award Amount - $7,395.00**

**Service Term**

**Half Time**

**Hours - 900**

**SNA Living Allowance- $13,050** 

**Segal Education Award Amount - $3,697.50** 

● Student loan forbearance for those who qualify

● Health insurance coverage and Child Care assistance for those who qualify

Placement Type: Temporary

Salary: Living Allowance

Schedule: Full Time and Part Time

Ability to commute/relocate: Brooklyn, NY

Education: High school (mandatory), some college credit or Bachelor’s (Preferred) Work Location: One location

title: Residential Counselor (Part-time and overnight)
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**

**Residential Counselor**

**Triple C is a well-founded, grass-roots organization that has helped to make the dream of living independently with dignity become a reality for those they serve throughout Middlesex, Monmouth and Ocean counties. We are in growth mode and are looking for like-minded individuals who have a passion for people and want to contribute to our mission. To fulfill that goal, we are currently looking for a Senior Residential Counselor to serve as the external face of Triple C in the community.**

**OVERVIEW**

The Residential Counselor is responsible for daily support to consumers, carries out day to day quality rehabilitative support services and facilities group work. Provides direct care support and promotes consumer independence by developing Individual Recovery Plans, establishing goals, monitoring progress and ensuring continuity of care.

As per N.J.A.C. 10:37A-7.2(b)], duties minimally include: onsite service and support; communicating observations and information about the consumer to the Program Coordinator, RN and treatment team; organizing and facilitating group work, i.e., budgeting, recreational and socialization activities; residential counseling; crisis intervention services (excluding crisis intervention counseling), participation in development of service plans; participation in service coordination; documenting observations, information and services in progress notes; and provides transportation.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Service/Compliance:**

· Ensures compliance with the Division of Mental Health and Addiction Services (DMHAS), Centers for Medicare and Medicaid (CMS) governing regulations, as well as agency policies and procedures.

· Promote wellness and recovery activities using evidence based best practices inclusive of Motivational Interviewing (MI), Illness Management and Recovery (IMR), Wellness and Recovery Action Plan (WRAP), and Integrated Dual Disorders Treatment (IDDT).

· Review service plans regularly to determine the need for continued social services and modifies as necessary.

· Document observations and communicate information to the Senior Residential Counselor, Program Coordinator, RN and treatment team.

· Provide medication supervision and tracking within agency prescribed guidelines.

· At times, may facilitate consumer groups, focusing on common educational themes such as banking, shopping, gentle exercise, social and recreational planning.

· Participate in special consumer related functions, e.g.: community nights, agency sponsored functions, etc.

**Administrative:**

· Prepare required documentation timely and accurately for consumer charts, as per established agency guidelines. (Case notes, weekly progress notes, recovery plans, communication log, etc…) and maintains caseload. Completes all required billing documentation accurately and timely.

· Complete required activities and documentation on fire drills, safety inspections, vehicle inspections, home related inspections.

· Provide transportation and assists consumers with navigating public transportation and Medicaid cab.

· Participate in the preparation for audits and licensing inspections.

· Secure consumer funds when necessary, under direction of Senior Residential Counselor and Program Coordinator.

· Complete annually required trainings.

**KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES**

· Ability to work with difficult situations and handle matters with sound judgment and discretion, following prescribed agency protocols.

· Effective verbal, written and electronic communication skills, with the ability to exercise critical thinking skills.

· Ability to handle multiple projects and prioritize accordingly in a changing environment.

· Ability to operate motor vehicle (car/minivan) safely, using defensive driving techniques.

**REQUIREMENTS**

· Bachelor’s degree in mental health or human services from an accredited college or university; or the equivalent of four years experience/education in the field; Licensed RN; LPN with two years related life or work experience; High school or GED with four years of related work or life experience.

· Prior hands on experience in the field a plus.

· First Aid and CPR certification.

· Possess valid driver’s license in state of residence and driving record in compliance with Agency policy.

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

· Moderate physical effort to assist consumer in home environment with daily living activities.

· Some lifting may be required, in addition to walking, sitting, stooping, standing, bending, and driving.

**Benefits**

* 401(k)
* Employee assistance program
* Paid sick time
* Qualified Non-profit Agency for Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF)
* Offers FREE in-house CEU credits provided by Relias

**Agency Perks and Discounts**

* Employee Assistance Program
* AT&T Employee Discount

Work setting:

* In-person

Part time or overnight

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
description:
Very Competitive rates \\* with cases readily available to assign today.

**About Us:** Prospect Kids is looking to hire Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) and Licensed Behavior Analysts (LBA) to service ABA clients in NYC. We are based in Brooklyn however we work with children in all 5 boroughs. This opportunity is excellent for someone looking to really help make a difference for families in need. A BCBA is a health care professional who studies the behavior of children and adults and creates plans to improve or change problematic behaviors providing Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA). We specialize in providing the gold standard of Applied Behavior Analysis services for children with Autism Spectrum Disorders from toddlers to age 21.

WE ARE LOOKING FOR RUSSIAN SPEAKING BCBA'S WITH MMIS # PREFERABLE

**Responsibilities**

* Provide behavioral health treatments for clients with autism and autism spectrum disorders and related disorders including Asperger’s Syndrome, Childhood Disintegrative Disorder, Pervasive Developmental Disorders or Rett Syndrome.
* Work in homes, and other locations with children implementing established goals and following treatment protocols.
* Monitor and collect information about the client’s behavior and skills using data collection.
* Develop behavior treatment plans that are unique to each child and teach ABA, social, and daily living skills.

**Benefits**

* Flexible hours
* Competitive Pay Rates
* Readily available cases
* Monday to Friday with some weekend availability
* Flexible scheduling and independent work where possible - cases across all 5 boroughs

**Qualifications**

* Master's Degree
* MMIS # preferable
* BCBA certificate and be qualified to work with young children
* Must be physically able to perform the job functions and other duties as assigned.
* Ability to train and support staff as needed
* Must possess a high degree of professionalism and commitment to handling confidential information.
* Exceptional communication, collaboration, problem solving and organizational skills.

\\* Salary based on contract and experience

If you are ready to accelerate your BCBA career with Prospect Kids Early Intervention agency. We encourage you to submit your most up to date resume to Indeed or apply directly on our website https://www.prospectkidsei.com

title: Warehouse Technician (Pharmaceutical)
description:
**Essential Job Function:**

Responsible for the staging of material and equipment in two Glatt locations (Ramsey and/or Mahwah).

Prepare materials to be transported between locations. Daily performance of warehouse, shipping and receiving duties as requested.

Must have the ability to manipulate up to 100kg’s (200 lbs). To cover shift deficits in the event of vacation, absence or high productivity periods. Adhere to all GMP’s and SOP’s while operating under a best practices environment.

**General Information:**

* High School graduate.
* Computer literate including the Microsoft suite and internal generic software applications.
* Experience with all warehouse operations.
* Ability to work well with others.
* Attention to detail and be highly organized.
* Valid drivers license.
* Ability to be trained and certified in the shipment of hazardous materials and controlled substances.

**Responsibilities to include, but not limited to:**

This position is classified as a “safety sensitive” position and is subject to random drug testing.

1. Transferring pharmaceutical and non-pharmaceutical materials and equipment between warehouses.

2. Maintain strict compliance with applicable FDA regulations, Company policies and procedures.

3. Loading and unloading shipments and deliveries via the safe use of all warehouse equipment including fork trucks, scissor lift and pallet movers.

4. Must have the ability to work within multiple electronic computer systems, both generic and commercial applications, to effectively support all departments within the Glatt group

5. Must be trained to work in a highly regulated controlled substances environment.

6. Execute receipts, shipments and other various duties within Microsoft Dynamics (Probatch and Business Central).

7. Complete and post accurate and timely receipts, transfers and shipments in Microsoft Dynamics.

8. Ordering of department supplies.

9. Identify, distribute and store, materials, supplies and equipment.

10. Locate and retrieve materials via mobile scanning devices, move and transport equipment and supplies as requested for Contract Manufacturing and all other departments within the Glatt group.

11. Prepare Bills of Lading, Packing slips and Commercial Invoices.

12. Schedule UPS, Fed Ex, World Courier shipments as required.

13. Staging and de-staging of materials for manufacturing activities, shipment or onsite long term storage

14. Communicate accurately and effectively with, all Glatt staff,management and any support staff on or off site including third party vendors.

15. All other duties as assigned by management.

title: Newark: KIPP Forward 12th Grade College & Career Match Counselor
description:
**Company Description** **About KIPP New Jersey**


KIPP New Jersey is part of the nationally recognized “Knowledge Is Power Program” network of free, open-enrollment, college-preparatory public schools dedicated to preparing students for success in college and in life. In 2002, 80 fifth graders walked through the doors of our first middle school in Newark, New Jersey and KIPP New Jersey has since grown to educate 8,135 students in grades K-12 across 17 schools in Newark and Camden. More than 90% of KIPP New Jersey students currently qualify for free or reduced meals.


By 2025, KIPP New Jersey will provide a world-class education to over 10,300 students across fifteen schools in Newark and five in Camden. To learn more, visit www.kippnj.org.

 **Job Description** **Here's what you need to know:**


At KIPP NJ, our mission states that we prepare our students to change the world. We believe that, for most of our students, a Bachelor’s degree is the stepping stone for students to pursue professional and personal success. We also believe that this is not the only path to professional and personal success, and are committed to supporting 100% of our students, including those who choose a non-college post-secondary pathway. We believe in career exploration and exposure throughout high school so all students leave with a strong sense of their passion, purpose, and plan for a strong start in college or a progressive professional pathway of their choosing. We know that truly preparing students for college and career requires an intense focus on student GPAs and ACT results, experiential learning opportunities such as summer programs and dual enrollment courses, excellent college & career counseling, and strong relationships with and programming for students and their families.


The College & Career Match Counselor’s job is to support a college and career ready trajectory for our students. We expect our Match Counselor to build strong and trust relationships with students, and use effective advising skills to support students in taking all necessary steps to graduate from high school and ultimately matriculate to a post-secondary program of highest aspiration.

**Here's what you'll be doing:**

**Outcomes**

* **College & Career matriculation and enrollment:** students matriculate to and enroll in quality post-secondary programs, aligned with their long-term career goals
* **Avoiding Undermatch:** students matriculating to college matriculate to schools with high graduation rates, maximizing their likelihood of college completion
* **Strong relationships:** counselor has strong relationships with students
* **Avoiding College & Career melt:** students who matriculate to quality post-secondary receive the support necessary to avoid barriers to enrollment
* **Early Applications:** students with strong academic profiles apply early to selective colleges with quality applications, maximizing their likelihood of admission
* **Financial Aid:** students complete financial aid applications and steps necessary for matriculation to quality post-secondary programs

**Match**

* Conduct ongoing 1:1 check-ins (at least 2-3 per quarter) with caseload of 12th grade students (~80 students) to support them through the application process and to help them maintain momentum for a strong finish to their senior year
* Guide each student through the process of applying to “right fit” colleges and/or career programs using students’ balanced wishlists from 11th grade
* Maintain consistent engagement and partnership with families of 12th grade students
* Support students and families in filling out financial aid applications, scholarship paperwork, and applications to special programs such as EOF
* Complete Letters of Recommendation for students, and train teachers on writing quality recommendations
* Support students in preparing for and completing key application steps, including interviews and document submission
* Hold College & Career Decision meetings with students and families, sharing key information and guiding students and families in making decisions that are aligned with students’ passion/purpose/plan
* Support each student’s transition to college or their post-secondary pathway through the completion of pre-college & career benchmarks as well as matriculation checklist tasks (such as making their tuition deposit, engaging in loan counseling (if applicable), etc.)
* Support HS juniors in May and June with learning more about the college financial aid process, writing personal statements, and researching colleges and Career Technical Education (CTE) programs to finalize their balanced wishlists

**Student & Family Programming**

* Support students in learning about career and college options, including participating in fly-in programs, attending open houses and information sessions, and touring campuses
* Support and co-plan school-wide match events (College & Career Fair, College & Career program representative visits, Instant Decision Days, family nights, senior activities, ACT testing days, etc)
* Plan and lead workshops for families on the essential topics related to financial aid, high school, and postsecondary success

**Data Management**

* Track meeting notes and student data - both qualitative and quantitative - consistently and accurately
* Analyze student academic data to drive action planning and support plans
* Utilize financial aid tracker to track all financial aid packages and provide families with a clear comparison of options from a financial perspective
* Constantly assess student progress and consistently communicate results to the Associate Director, families, and teammates

**School Support**

* Push into 11th and 12th grade College & Career Readiness classes as needed
* Attend grade-level meetings and support 12th grade team and school functions as needed

  

**Qualifications** **Skills**

* Proficient in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel
* Experience with database management and reporting (such as Salesforce, Overgrad, etc.)
* Strong written and oral communication skills
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Strong organization skills and meticulous attention to detail
* Superb customer service skills and love and support for families and children
* Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills
* Adept at data analysis and strong content knowledge; ability to extract meaningful insights and actions from data

**Abilities**

* Commitment to do whatever it takes to ensure our teachers and students have what they need to be successful
* Ability to build strong relationships with students and families
* Ability to proactively problem solve; anticipate challenges before they occur
* Ability to develop and manage multiple projects simultaneously and comfortably with ambiguity
* Ability to troubleshoot and manage high stress situations with a calm and positive demeanor
* Ability to work evenings and weekends
* Student Focus: Belief that all students, regardless of background, have the ability to go to and through college; demonstrated commitment to the school’s unique community
* Cultural Competence: Demonstrated ability to create inclusive environments that honors and supports a diversity of backgrounds and perspectives

**Must Haves:**

* Demonstrated experience working with traditionally under-served students and their families from diverse socioeconomic, racial, and ethnic backgrounds
* Previous experience with Postsecondary Access or Postsecondary Success Counseling

  

**Additional Information** **Compensation & Benefits**


In addition to a competitive salary, KIPP NJ offers a full comprehensive benefits plan, including health care, retirement, a school laptop, and transportation benefits for TEAMmates commuting into New Jersey from the New York City area.
company_description: KIPP has a 20-year track record of preparing students for success in college and life.

title: Dental Office Manager
description:
**Join Our Team as a Bilingual Dental Office Manager!**

Are you passionate about dental office management and eager to lead the expansion, viability of practice capabilities, optimize production, and enhance team abilities? We are looking for a dynamic individual to join our dental practice as a Dental Office Manager!

**About Us:** At Complete Dental Works, we are committed to providing outstanding dental care with a focus on patient satisfaction and oral health excellence. As we expand our services and capabilities, we are seeking a proactive leader to drive growth and innovation within our practice.

**Role Overview:** As our Bilingual Dental Office Manager, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing the expansion, production efficiency, and skill development of our team. You will lead initiatives to enhance patient care, operational effectiveness, and staff performance.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Practice Expansion:** Collaborate with dentists and stakeholders to develop and execute strategies for practice growth, including expanding service offerings and implementing new technologies.
* **Patient Acceptance Case Management:** Manage patient acceptance cases from initial consultation through treatment planning and acceptance, ensuring clear communication and informed decision-making.
* **Production Optimization:** Manage scheduling and workflow to maximize dental chair utilization and operational efficiency.
* **Team Development:** Mentor and develop dental staff, fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill enhancement.
* **Financial Oversight:** Monitor financial performance, budgeting, and revenue goals to support practice growth and sustainability.

**Additional Responsibilities:**

* **Quality Assurance:** Implement and maintain quality assurance protocols to uphold clinical standards and patient satisfaction.
* **Regulatory Compliance:** Ensure compliance with dental regulations, HIPAA guidelines, and safety protocols.
* **Technology Integration:** Evaluate, implement, and train staff on new technologies to enhance practice operations and patient care.
* **Community Engagement:** Represent the practice in the community, building relationships and promoting dental health education initiatives.

**Requirements:**

* Proven experience in dental office management, with a focus on practice expansion, production optimization, and team development.
* Strong financial acumen and experience in budget management and financial reporting.
* Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a team.
* Proficiency in dental software systems (Dentrix Ascend)

If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for dental practice management and bilingual communication skills, we invite you to apply for the Dental Office Manager position at Complete Dental Work. Join us in shaping the future of our practice and delivering exceptional dental care to our patients!

title: X-Ray Supervisor
description:
**SIGN ON BONUS $5,000**



Opportunities with Optum in the Tri-State region (formerly CareMount Medical, ProHEALTH New York, Crystal Run Healthcare and Riverside Medical Group). Come make a difference in the lives of people who turn to us for care at one of our hundreds of locations across New York, New Jersey and Connecticut. Work with state-of-the-art technology and brilliant co-workers who share your passion for helping people feel their best. Join a dynamic health care organization and discover the meaning behind **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**



CareMount Medical, P.C. is the largest independent multispecialty medical group in New York State, providing comprehensive medical care of the highest quality to over 640,000 patients in more than 45 locations throughout Westchester, Putnam, Dutchess, Columbia, and Ulster counties and New York City. Founded in 1946 as Mount Kisco Medical Group, CareMount has grown to over 600 physicians and advanced practice professionals representing more than 40 different medical specialties. CareMount is affiliated with world-class organizations including Massachusetts General Hospital, Mount Sinai Health System, and Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. CareMount offers on-site laboratory and radiology services, endoscopy and infusion suites, and operates eight urgent-care centers. Our physicians are frequently recognized as best doctors in respected publications and have been featured in lists including New York Magazine’s “Best Doctors,” Westchester and Hudson Valley Magazine’s “Top Doctors” as well as in Castle Connolly Medical’s “Top Doctors.” For additional information about CareMount Medical and its specialties, please visit: www.caremountmedical.com.

The group has always maintained a firm commitment to each of our patients...to provide high quality medical and surgical care in a warm, friendly setting, and in a caring manner. Each and every member of our professional and support staff is dedicated to this ideal - physicians, nurses, technicians and support personnel.



The X-Ray Supervisor provides clinical, organizational, and scheduling support/leadership to a fast paced, multimodality multi-location radiology practice. The position with a technical focus on X-Ray, will facilitate workflow by acting as a clinical liaison between all modalities, radiologist's, and front desk to maximize clinical services on a daily basis.

**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Prepare monthly technologist schedules in x-ray to coordinate with current radiologist staffing in order to maximize workflow including vacations, eTime issues, and related day-to-day coverage
* Communicate daily department staffing (radiologist/technologists) to front desk scheduling coordinator
* Perform clinical exams as needed in any location
* Organize/approve add on "stat" exams to maximize workflow within the department
* Assist Clinical Operations Manager in development of clinical x-ray protocols for use within the entire practice
* Lead contact in the preparation and submission of all ACR accreditations
* Independently resolve issues and coordinate appropriate departmental resources (clerical, file room, clinical) when needed to facilitate workflow. Follow up as needed
* Inform Clinical Operations Supervisor on a daily basis of all departmental activities needing supervisory action
* Maintain strictest confidentiality in all aspects
* Perform other related duties assigned as necessary


You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in health care administration, public health, business administration, or related degree
* NY State Licensure in Radiologic Technology
* ARRT certification/licensure
* 3+ years of experience as a technologist with three years supervisory
* Proven ability to communicate clearly and professionally to all staff and physicians


*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*


*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*


*UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*

title: Phlebotomist
description:
**$2,000 Sign-on Bonus for External Candidate****s**


**Opportunities with Optum in the Tri-State region** (formerly CareMount Medical, ProHEALTH New York and Riverside Medical Group). Come make a difference in the lives of people who turn to us for care at one of our hundreds of locations across New York, New Jersey and Connecticut. Work with state-of-the-art technology and brilliant co-workers who share your passion for helping people feel their best. Join a dynamic health care organization and discover the meaning behind **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**



The Phlebotomist performs venipuncture and capillary puncture on adults, neonates, and pediatric patients; collects urine specimens; performs EKG and spirometry on adult and pediatric patients; participates in the instruction of new personnel; works with computer; communicates in a manner that promotes Laboratory professionalism as well as a comfortable phlebotomy.


**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Blood collection: from adult and pediatric patients using vacutainer, syringe and butterfly techniques; capillary puncture using heel and fingerstick techniques
* Identifies and labels specimens appropriately
* Instructs patients in regard to urine and stool collection procedures
* Enters accessioning data into the computer
* Prepares specimens for send out testing
* Inventories supplies and prepares phlebotomy stations to effectively collect blood
* Attends required meetings
* Enhances professional growth and development through in-service meetings and education programs
* Performs EKG, Holter Monitor, and Spirometry procedures
* Maintains patient confidentiality
* Performs related work as required
* Provide Surgical Scheduling, precertification and scheduling maintenance of surgeries for one or more Physicians
* Provide quality Customer Service to the patients and visitors courteously and promptly
* Must possess solid interpersonal skills to communicate effectively with co-workers, Management Staff, and Physicians
* Provide surgical instructions, communicate patient financial responsibility, and secure prepayment from patients and/or financial agreements according to established policies and procedures
* Must be able to work effectively and cooperatively as a team member, balancing both the support of the physician(s) and following the financial policies established by CAREMOUNT MEDICAL and ASCW
* Demonstrate professionalism in appearance and actions with patients, staff, Physicians and Administrators at all times
* Maintains confidentiality of patient information
* Other duties may be assigned


You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.



**Required Qualifications:**


* Certification from an accredited phlebotomy diploma program
* 1+ years of phlebotomy (Additional appropriate education may be substituted for the minimum experience requirement)


**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**


* Knowledge of laboratory techniques to perform blood, urine and stool collection
* Knowledge of container and minimum volume requirements for specimen collection. Knowledge regarding the technical correctness of EKG and spirometry printouts
* Knowledge regarding the proper attachment of a Holter monitor
* Skill in labeling and dispersing specimens to appropriate stations
* Skill in interacting with patients representing a broad physical and socioeconomic spectrum. Skill in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with patients, laboratory staff and medical staff


**Typical Physical Demands:**


* Full range of body motion including manual and finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination
* Frequent standing, walking and bending required for extended periods of time
* Be able to support the body weight of an adult patient when moving from a chair to an exam table
* Visual acuity and normal color perception


**Working Conditions:** Exposure to communicable diseases, toxic substances, ionizing radiation, medicinal preparations, and other conditions common to a medical group and laboratory environment.


**New York Residents Only:** The hourly range for this role is $16.00 to $28.27 per hour. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. title: Behavior Technician (Free Training) - Queens

As an accomplished professional in the Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) field, your skills and dedication align with our dedication to providing excellence to our clients.

Apply today and be a part of our dynamic and fulfilling community!

With a focus on excellence and innovation, we provide a wide range of facility management solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of each client. We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced **Payroll Coordinator** to join our team. In this role, you will play a critical part in ensuring accurate and timely processing of payroll and related tasks. You will be responsible for various payroll duties including reviewing and exporting hours out of the Time & Attendance software, weekly payroll processing, handling union reports, Onboarding, and other related administrative tasks as required.


**Responsibilities:**


* Review, audit, and process multi-state payroll for Union, exempt and non-exempt employees
* Preparing monthly union reports
* Ensure compliance with CBAs, union rules, and labor regulations
* Update and process union-specific payroll deductions, including union dues, pension contributions, and other mandated deductions
* Ensures accurate and timely processing of payroll updates including new hires, terminations, and changes to pay rates
* Oversee new hires onboarding processes
* Track and update sick/vacation time
* Assist with training staff on time keeping, payroll, and onboarding processes
* Ensures compliance with federal, state, and local payroll, wage, and hour laws and best practices
* Assist with employee inquiries on benefits contribution/coverage, FMLA, disability, and leave related matters
* Maintain accurate records and documentation related to benefits and leave administration, ensuring compliance with company policies and regulatory requirements
* Participate in HRIS-related projects to streamline and improve efficiency and effectiveness
* Communicate updates, discrepancies, and other issues with the Payroll Corp team
* Assist with Quarter end/Year-end payroll processes
* Collaborate with HR and finance departments to resolve payroll discrepancies and issues
* Maintain accurate payroll records and files in accordance with company policies and regulatory requirements
* Perform other related duties as assigned


**Required Skills/Abilities:**


* Comprehensive knowledge and experience with Payroll, HR and benefits administration
* Multi-state/multi-union payroll experience highly preferred
* Strong familiarity with laws pertaining to payroll FLSA
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Outstanding focus on detail
* Experience in working in a fast-paced environment
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word)
* Experience with UKG a plus
* At least 4 years of experience in HR/Payroll is highly preferred


**Education and Experience:**


* Bachelor’s degree in a related field (e.g., Business Management) preferred


**Benefits:**


* Salary range: $80,000 - $90,000/yr
* Paid holidays and vacation time
* Health Benefits Package
* Ancillary benefits—Life insurance, Long Term Disability, FSA, and Dependent Spending care
* 401K
* Opportunity for growth
* Bonus Pay


**EEO Notice:**


Pritchard Industries is an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, genetic information, religion, national origin, ethnicity, gender; gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition, age, disability, or handicap, servicemember status, relationship or association with a protected veteran, and any other category protected by Federal, state, or local law.

title: Security Officer - Harlem
description:
**Company Description**

Natures Finest Security is a dynamic and innovative company that is committed to providing innovative security solutions. We take pride in providing a full range of security management services. Integrity and professionalism are of the utmost importance. We are committed to excellence and maintaining the highest industry standards for security officers.

**Position Summary**

The Security Guard is responsible for the protection, safeguarding and security of assets, personnel, customers, tenants, visitors, and other people and property on our grounds.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* Ensure a safe environment through a team effort of diligent active patrol, strict access control, monitoring, and equipment control
* Be visible and observant, greeting staff, guests, and vendors in a courteous and attentive manner
* Inspect and patrol premises regularly
* Respond immediately to distress calls, panic alarms, and emergency calls for disorderly conduct, disruptive persons, and incidents
* Maintain the company’s reputation with professionalism and legal compliance
* Enforce policies and procedures of the company
* Collaborate with other security officers for effective protection and coverage
* Control and monitor surveillance equipment, and perform building and equipment inspections
* Complete and submit daily reports, including relevant information, observations, surveillance footage, and signatures
* Neutralize situations calmly with tact and common sense
* Perform requests by the customers within scope of security duties or within reason
* Performing other work-related duties as assigned

Natures Finest Security  
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES)

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Three years proven experience as a professional security guard
* One year of excellent customer service skills
* Excellent time management skills

License/Certification Requirements

* Security Officer License

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT**  
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; for extended periods of time (6 to 8 ours) reach with hands and arms; run, climb, or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or  
crawl. The employee must lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

**NOTE**  
This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. All duties and responsibilities are essential functions and requirements and are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. To perform this job successfully, the incumbents will possess the skills, aptitudes, and abilities to perform each duty proficiently. Some requirements may exclude individuals who pose a direct threat or significant risk to the health or safety of themselves or others. The requirements listed in this document are the minimum levels of knowledge, skills, or abilities. title: Behavior Technician
description:
·

**Join our team!** 

If you are passionate about working with individuals with Autism and are caring, reliable, and passionate, we want YOU on our Mastermind team! We are looking to hire RBTs and ABA therapists who are interested in making a difference in the lives of their clients.

Mastermind Behavior Services, a premier provider of ABA therapy services, was founded on the fundamental goal of helping children reach their fullest potential so they can live a rewarding and fulfilling life. At Mastermind, a child’s diagnosis does not define them. We view each individual as unique and create an individualized program which allows them to learn and progress.

* Competitive Pay
* Professional Development & Growth Opportunities
* PTO & Sick Pay
* Annual Raises

The Behavior Technician provides direct care services to individuals with autism spectrum disorders (ASD). In addition, they follow through with skill acquisition and behavior programs as developed by the BCBA and indicated in the treatment plan. Other duties include, but are not limited to:

* Provide direct services to clients based on current treatment plan
* Maintain confidentiality with all client records and information.

* Notify supervisor and family for employee-initiated cancellations.
* Notify supervisor for family-initiated cancellations.
* Conduct self in a professional manner and maintains professional boundaries when working with client in any setting.

* Reliable means of transportation
* Must pass state and county background check

title: Quality Control Lab Technician
description:
**Evaric Pharmaceuticals, Inc.** is a generic pharmaceutical company headquartered in Hauppauge, NY, which is fast expanding. Our core company generic pharmaceutical products are of high quality and cost-effective in the manufacturing, production, marketing and distribution sectors. Evaric has a rugged product pipeline for production and has filed a few ANDAs. To make the world a better place to live in, our mission is to provide healthcare at a cost-effective pace.

**Description:** The QC Lab Technician supports the laboratory workflow in an efficient and effective manner by assisting the Analytical and Quality Control Chemists / Scientists in maintaining the laboratory. The QC Lab Technician also has a basic understanding or the ability to learn the requirements and regulations in the Pharmaceutical industry; such as, GMPs/GDPs and routine quality control sampling and testing procedures. This position reports directly to the QC Associate Director.

**Responsibilities:**

* Performs routine daily balance checks and assists with minor lab equipment maintenance or instrument calibration.
* Monitors the Volumetric Solutions and Test Solutions so that they are current.
* Work with supervisor to, initiate optimization experiments
* Coordinates laboratory sample retrieval and entry into lab systems following standard procedures.
* Regular lab maintenance
* Maintain accurate records of procedures and experimental results
* Maintain the Dissolution Laboratory ie. Ensure the cleanliness and operation of the Equipment
* Prepare Dissolution Media and perform the test on Dissolutions Apparatus
* Organizes and maintains the inventory of laboratory supplies.
* Obtains samples and identifies raw materials from drums.
* Ensures the glassware is washed and dried according to the SOP and that the supply is adequate to ensure smooth operation of the laboratory.
* Assists analysts with preparation of reagents, diluents or solution’s following written procedures or methods.
* Assist analysts with simple lab tests such as pH, LOD, viscosity and physical appearance.
* Ensure Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPs) are followed and contribute to the management of regulatory affairs.
* Ensure proper sampling & sample submission of incoming raw material and products including timely disposition, proper retention of samples and documentation of product analysis records.
* Perform & record appropriate physical evaluation such as Disintegration Time & Weight Variation etc.
* Monitors the Volumetric Solutions and Test Solutions so that they are current.

**Education Requirements:**

High School diploma or equivalent and working towards a Bachelor's in Chemistry or related field.

**Benefits:** 

We offer a comprehensive compensation package, which includes medical, dental, vision and life insurance as well as an employer-matched 401(k) plan.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the US. Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. Together with passing background and drug testing.

title: Salesforce Field Service Cloud Technical Architect Manager - Resources
description:
**We Are**


Accenture’s Salesforce practice, and we live to see what this platform can do. Since we were one of the first on the scene, we’re the largest global Salesforce practice, not to mention one of the best. In fact, we are the industry leader for building Salesforce solutions, and we are Master Certified in all 12 industries and clouds. We use tech like Lightning, Einstein, and Bolt to build stronger, better relationships with customers. And we are always learning. We’re building the most resourceful team on the planet, and helping our people with new skills, training, and support to get over 4,200 certifications including Certified Technical Architect (CTA). Visit us here to find out more about Accenture's Salesforce practice.

**You Are**


A strong Salesforce Field Service Cloud Technical Architect with strong leadership skills and a talent for shepherding projects along in a timely and efficient manner so that companies can do more. Communication and relationship-building skills? You have both in spades and you use them to identify requirements, craft solutions, and get clients to green light proposals. You’re not daunted by sophisticated problems, thanks to your next-level analytical, organizational, and time-management skills, and you are extraordinary at bringing out the best in team members.

**The Work**

* Lead and facilitate discovery and scoping sessions with clients
* Understand client business process and potential constraints (budget, timeline, expertise, etc.) to define optimal and reasonable project scope and expectations
* Create and defend solution estimate and SOW
* Incorporate past experiences, business savvy, creative and out-of-the-box thinking in designing solutions; offer multiple, potential solutions
* Coordinate with Technical Architects/CTA's, integration, and data consultants, and others, as needed, for specific technical design requirements
* Provide recommendations on third-party applications
* Handle expectations with clients, Accenture colleagues, as well as SFDC and other 3rd parties - i.e., be able to influence and guide towards successful outcomes
* Disseminate standard methodologies on solution positioning and delivery.
* Own the solution and provide architectural oversight of the solution throughout the project
* Provide guidance and advisory support to project team on implementation approach and sophisticated configuration issues
* Participate in QA checkpoints during delivery to provide guidance and ensure solution aligns with original scope
* Work with project team to develop and validate estimates to support any Change Orders
* Participate in project status meetings, as requested by the Delivery Lead/Project Manager
* Contribute to estimating and SOW templates for future phases
* Lead business and technical requirements definition and prioritization/scoping of requirements.
* Understand SFS Scheduling and optimization configuration, out-of-box capabilities and configuration of scheduling policies, work rules & Service Objectives
* Understand Field Service Mobile app capabilities, including offline architecture, capabilities and how to complement it with other supporting architecture including Salesforce Mobile app and third-party mobile applications
* Understand SFS resource management, contractors, timesheets, operating hours, shifts, primary and secondary territory setup. inventory management (return, request & track)
* Understand API capabilities to integrate in and out of Salesforce and SFS API capabilities
* Understand Salesforce Field Service (SFS) architecture, Work Order and Service Appointment life cycle, bulk scheduling, dispatch, unschedule. Preventive maintenance and configuration of Dispatcher Gantt
* Maintain and coordinate communication with the customer throughout each project.
* Mentor more junior team members in business analysis, project management, and Salesforce.com best practices.
  

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.


  

**Here’s What You Need**

* Experience supporting Resources clients and/or the Resources Industry
* A minimum of 5 years’ experience working on the Salesforce.com platform
* A minimum of 3 years’ experience in the capacity of a Technical Consultant and/or Technical Architect.
* A minimum of 2 years’ experience in Salesforce Field Service Cloud development
* A Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If Associate’s Degree, must have minimum 6 years work experience)
**Bonus Points If**

* You have a strong technical background, analytical, and problem-solving
* You have experience in migrating customers from click software to Salesforce Field Service (SFS)
* You have experience in hands on design, prototyping, configurations, testing and other implementation activities.
* You have experience in scoping, planning, and presenting project plans.
* You have experience as a team member of successful software project implementations related to Service Cloud, or ServiceMax.
* You have awareness of web, database, and object-oriented software technologies, and salesforce.com / force.com.
* You have experience in a consulting organization.
  

Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, District of Columbia, Maryland, New York or Washington as set forth below.  

We accept applications on an on-going basis and there is no fixed deadline to apply.


Information on benefits is here.


Role Location Annual Salary Range


California $93,400 to $224,600


Colorado $93,400 to $194,100


District of Columbia $99,500 to $206,700


New York $86,500 to $224,600


Maryland $86,500 to $179,700


Washington $99,500 to $206,700

 ***What We Believe***

 *We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.*

description:

**You Are**


A Salesforce Field Service Developer - Resources with a keen eye for problem solving. You work with project teams to identify and analyze clients’ requirements and craft the right solution. On top of this, you’ve got the communication skills to build the right rapport clients to get the project off the ground. Organization is your forte. You prioritize multiple projects at once with aplomb and always deliver quality work on time.

**The Work**

* Meet with clients and senior analysts to gather business requirements.
* Design, build, and configure applications to meet business processes and application requirements.
* Develop custom and out-of-the-box solutions using Salesforce and Field Service functionality (APEX, SOQL, Lightning Component/Lightning Web Components, Visualforce as well as declarative tools such as Field Service mobile flows)
* Participate in software development life cycle from requirements analysis to deployment.
* Provide documentation for reference/maintenance.
* Implement solutions using standard methodology and participate in peer for code reviews and unit testing.
* Support post deployment activities including knowledge transfer, process documentation, and application bug fixes.
  

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.

* You have experience in Cloud based Field Service solutions.
* You have experience in Salesforce.com implementations.

title: Sales Performance and Analysis Manager
description:
**Title: Sales Excellence – Sales Performance & Analysis Advisor**

**Role (Job Profile): Analytics & Modeling Manager**

 **About Accenture:**


Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world’s leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services—creating tangible value at speed and scale. We are a talent and innovation led company with 738,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries.


Technology is at the core of change today, and we are one of the world’s leaders in helping drive that change, with strong ecosystem relationships. We combine our strength in technology with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability. We are uniquely able to deliver tangible outcomes because of our broad range of services, solutions and assets across Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X and Accenture Song. These capabilities, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360° value, enable us to help our clients succeed and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities.


At Accenture, we believe your career is about what you want to be and who you want to be. It’s about bringing your skills, your curiosity, and your best true self to your work. Here, you’ll match your ingenuity with the latest technology to do incredible things. Together, we can create positive, long-lasting change.

**We are:**


Sales Excellence at Accenture. We empower our people to compete, win and grow. We develop everything they need to build and mature their client portfolios, optimize their deals and enable their sales talent, all driven by sales intelligence.

**You are:**

* Someone who bases stories on evidence with a knack for transforming data into business insights.
* You have grit: dead ends do not deter you, rather they're opportunities to apply critical thinking.
* You tend to have a few technical skills in your 'bat-belt' and lose track of time when analyzing trends.
* You are at your best with lots of data and metrics, doing the dot-connecting and figuring out the 'so what'.
* You are confident without being rigid, navigating the business and technical.
* You aren’t afraid to say, “I don’t know”.
* You are not a lonely rider: You are part of a global community of Analytics experts exchanging knowledge.

**The work:**


You will be a trusted advisor for leadership and enable them with business insights to drive profitable sales growth. Your responsibilities will include:

* Lead an Analytics team in providing stakeholders with insights on our sales performance & Independently deliver in a global environment.
* Partner with other Sales Excellence people and with internal clients to confirm business priorities, define success criteria, and measure outcomes.
* Help evolve Sales Excellence tools and champion their use by leadership and account teams.

  

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 5 years of analytics work in Sales, Pricing, Finance or Management Consulting.
* Bachelor's degree

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Understanding of Accenture sales process & systems, business mode
* English language fluency (oral and written)
* Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
* Intermediate skills in business analytics tools (Qlik, Tableau, or PowerBI)
* Experience in analytics in Sales, Pricing, Finance or a related field
* Experience working with senior leadership and creating executive-level briefings
* Experience managing and motivating a virtual team in a global environment
* Excellent oral & written communications skills
* Accuracy & attention to detail; ability to prioritize own workload and manage downstream stakeholders and resources
* Quality assurance/thoroughness
* Ability to work autonomously as a self-starter (see the need before it is known)
* Ability to work effectively in a remote, virtual, global environment

**Professional Skills:**

* Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian.

**You may also need:**

* A home office or work area that is suitable for productive remote work, per local guidelines. This includes a safe, ergonomic workspace and a high-speed internet connection that is stable and secure.

*Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, New York or Washington as set forth below. We accept applications on an on-going basis and there is no fixed deadline to apply.*

*Information on benefits is here.*

*California**$93,400 to $224,600*

*Colorado**$93,400 to $194,100*

*District of Columbia**$99,500 to $206,700*

*New York**$86,500 to $224,600*

*Maryland**$86,500 to $179,700*

*Washington**$99,500 to $206,700*

 *We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.*

title: 1:1 School Nurse needed in South Bound Brook, NJ
description:
**Come Join our Champions of Caring Today!**
