title: Brand Operations Associate
description:
**About Allara:**



Your health is not one thing; it's everything, and when it comes to hormonal health no two people are exactly the same. We built Allara to provide effective solutions and consistent 1:1 medical support for the countless women who felt unheard, rushed, or overlooked in traditional care models. Allara is not just one appointment—or three, or ten—it's a long-term plan with real access, attention, and understanding, where our care teams can drive solutions and manage your needs over time. We're listening to you, and your body, so you can live your healthiest, fullest life.


**About the role:**



As a Brand Associate at Allara, you'll play a crucial role in shaping and maintaining our brand identity across various channels. You'll work closely with our marketing team to ensure our message of empowerment and personalized care resonates with our community of patients and healthcare providers.



You'll be the heart of the Allara community, creating a welcoming space where our members can connect, share experiences, and support each other on their health journeys. You'll develop and implement strategies to increase engagement, moderate discussions, and ensure our community aligns with Allara's mission and values.



This role is based in New York City, with in-person work at least two times per week.


**Responsibilities:**


* Engage with our community to gather feedback and strengthen brand loyalty
* Act as a brand ambassador, embodying Allara's voice and values in all community interactions
* Moderate community interactions to maintain a positive, supportive environment
* Gather and analyze community feedback to inform product improvements and content creation
* Ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints
* Collaborate across departments to ensure the patient experience is always super


**Necessary Background:**


* 1+ year of experience in brand/community management or customer success
* Experience with community management tools and social media platforms
* Ability to empathize and connect with diverse audiences
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Strong organizational and multitasking abilities
* Creativity and ability to think outside the box
* Passion for women's health and wellness
* Strong understanding of women's health issues


**Benefits**


* Compensation: $50-60k salary + equity
* Medical/Dental/Vision
* 401(k)
* Unlimited PTO


At Allara, we believe in celebrating everything that makes us human and are proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We embrace diversity and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better we can serve our members. We're an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against candidates or patients based on race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

title: LPN - PACE
description:
**COME JOIN OUR TEAM!!!** **Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) - Great BENEFITS!!!** **Beacon of LIFE’s mission is to provide the newest healthcare and social service choices for elders living in Monmouth County and Ocean County. The Beacon of LIFE center was established to deliver PACE (Program of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly) services. The PACE model is centered on the belief that it is better for the well-being of seniors with chronic care needs and their families to be served in the community whenever possible.** **We are currently looking for a Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) - Clinic to join our team. Full-Time position includes a full benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance, PTO, 401k.** **About Us**


BoldAge delivers innovative, creative solutions for PACE (Program of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly). Our model of care enables older adults to live a meaningful, independent life at home with grace and dignity. We meet the evolving needs of older adults by providing innovative disciplinary solutions that consider both their physical and mental well-being. Our owner operated model is aimed at expanding the ability for older adults to live happily and healthfully in their own homes for as long as possible.

**LPN JOB SUMMARY**


Under the direction and supervision of the Clinic Services Supervisor, uses and practices basic assessment (data collection), participates in planning, executes, interventions in accordance with the care plan and contributes to the evaluation of individualized interventions related to the care plan. Administers medications, implements primary care orders, and evaluates participant complaints physically and/or by telephone. Provides education to the PACE organization, participant, and caregiver in regards to care plan, nursing treatments or medications. Communicates participant’s condition to primary care givers, physician and multidisciplinary team.

**REQUIREMENTS**

* Graduate of an accredited school of nursing.
* Current LPN license in good standing to practice in the required state.
* IV Certification preferred.
* Experience with paperless documentation preferred.
* 1 year of experience working with a frail or elderly population preferred. If this is not present, training on working with a frail or elderly population will be provided upon hiring.
* Must have reliable transportation, a valid driver's license, and the minimum state required liability auto insurance.
* Be medically cleared for communicable diseases and have all immunizations up-to-date before engaging in direct participant contact.
* Pass a comprehensive criminal background check that may include, but is not limited to, federal and state Medicare/Medicaid exclusion lists, criminal history, education verification, license verification, reference check, and drug screen.

**SKILLS AND ABILITIES**

* Broad knowledge base of health care problems of the frail elderly.
* Knowledge of medical equipment and instruments.
* Knowledge of common safety hazards and precautions to establish a safe work environment.
* Skilled in identifying problems and recommending solutions.
* Skilled in preparing and maintaining records and writing reports, and responding to correspondence.
* Skilled in developing and maintaining department quality assurance.
* Skilled in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with participants, medical staff, staff members and family caregivers.
* Ability to react calmly and effectively in emergency situations.
* Knowledge of medications used in geriatrics and adverse reactions.
* Skilled in wound care.


BoldAge PACE provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Laboratory Aide #Full Time
description:
**Job Summary:**


The Laboratory Aide is a key support member in the workflow of the lab and will work as team player to ensure the efficiency and turnaround time of the processing of Histology samples. The candidate will work closely with the Histotech and Shift Supervisor. The Laboratory Aide is responsible for accessioning, labeling, filing, writing slides, discarding old specimen samples and retrieving deeper and special requests from Pathologists.


**Job Responsibilities:**


* Maintenance and operating of laboratory equipment incongruence with Laboratory procedures and saftey policies.
* Receive large volume of biopsies from multiple couriers and ensure all biopsies are accounted for. Report any discrepancies.
* Data entry of all cases into the Laboratory Information System to ensure patient information and referring physician information is correct.
* File all blocks and slides & scheduled retrieval of blocks and slides from off-site warehouse.
* Dispose reagent waste and old specimen.
* Retrieve Pathologist requests for additional or special testing
	+ Write slides and print reports for all additional and special stains to be provided to Pathologist
	+ Assist in maintaining daily log of number of cases cut per Histotech
	+ Assist in transport of additional cases and special stains from Microtomy area to Staining Area.
* Store laboratory supplies and assist Supervisor in inventory control.
* Answer phones.
* Liaison in retrieval and delivery of requested slides, blocks, and requisitions.
* Scanning of daily requisitions.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.


**Job Qualifications:**


* High School Diploma or equivalent required.
* Demonstrate organizational and problem-solving skills, and the ability to troubleshoot any clerical issues that might arise
* Candidate must be able to learn how to operate the Laboratory Information System (LIS) used in the Department.
* Candidate must be well organized and be able to manage a demanding workload and moderately complex cases in an accurate and timely manner.
* Ability to participate as a member of a team, including demonstrating reliability, punctuality, professionalism, respect and adaptability to new and changing situations.
* Ability to work independently and multi-task.
* Candidate must be able to work independently and accurately in a fast-paced, action-oriented environment.
* Ability to work collaboratively with a culturally diverse staff demonstrating tact and sensitivity in stressful situations.
* Working proficiency of Microsoft Office (Word & Excel) or similar software is required and an ability and willingness to learn new systems and programs.
* Experience in a Histopathology and/or Immunohistochemistry lab is preferred.


**Hourly Rate Ranges: $20.40 - $28.56**


Note: Our salary offers will fall within these ranges based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to experience, skill set, training and education.


**61st Street Service Corporation**


At 61st Street Service Corporation we are committed to providing our client with excellent customer service while maintaining a productive environment for all employees. The Service Corporation offers a competitive comprehensive Benefit package to eligible employees; including Healthcare and various other benefits including Paid Time off to promote a healthy lifestyle.


We are an equal employment opportunity employer and we adhere to all requirements of all applicable federal, state, and local civil rights laws. Please be advised that the corporation requires COVID-19 vaccinations for all employees unless an exemption request for a disability / medical or religious accommodation has been approved.

title: Director, Learning & Development
description:
Are you ready to make an **impact**? Join Integris, where **integrity** meets **innovation**! Be part of a team that’s redefining IT services by leading with “**People First**”.


Integris is a leading IT solutions provider, offering high-touch services that clients love. Our team of highly experienced local professionals delivers best-in-class solutions, including dedicated vCIOs, specialized security and compliance advisory services, and a 24/7 help desk. As we rapidly expand across the country, both organically and through partnerships with like-minded managed IT service providers (MSPs), we remain committed to identifying the best talent available to play a crucial role in transforming IT services for our clients.


**Job Summary:**


The Learning & Development Director (LDD) is responsible for leading the strategy, design, and execution of comprehensive learning and development initiatives across the organization. The LDD will partner with senior leadership to align learning strategies with business goals, ensuring the development of talent at all levels. The LDD will foster a culture of continuous learning, drive leadership development programs, and manage organizational effectiveness interventions that enhance employee performance, engagement, and retention.


**Job Responsibilities:**


* Develop and implement a scalable, company-wide learning and development strategy that aligns with organizational goals and growth objectives.
* Create and evolve an “Integris University” Program, providing learning opportunities that effectively onboards new hires and allows for educational opportunities across the various Integris career pathways.
* Design and implement programs for leadership development at all levels, ensuring the creation of a strong leadership pipeline.
* Partner with Director of Talent and senior leadership to assess current and future talent development needs, identifying key skill gaps and delivering targeted learning initiatives to close them.
* Oversee the design, development, and delivery of learning programs, including e-learning, workshops, seminars, coaching, and mentoring.
* Lead initiatives focused on change management, team effectiveness, and other organizational development strategies that support business transformation and continuous improvement.
* Manage and leverage Learning Management Systems (LMS) and other technology platforms to scale learning programs and track key metrics.
* Employee Engagement & Culture: Partner with HR Business Partner Team to support and drive initiatives that enhance employee engagement, professional growth, and organizational culture through strategic learning programs.
* Oversee the L&D budget, ensuring resources are allocated effectively, and manage relationships with external training vendors and consultants.
* Partner with HR Operations Manager to track and analyze learning outcomes to assess the effectiveness of programs and continuously improve learning solutions.
* Ensure learning programs meet compliance requirements for all relevant certifications, training standards, and regulations.

**Job Qualifications:**


*Education/Certification Requirements:*


* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resouces, Organizational Development, Education, Business Administration, or related field. Master’s degree preferred.

*Experience Requirements:*


* 7+ years of progressive experience in Learning & Development, Organizational Development, or related field, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.
* Previous experience in the Information Technology industry is preferred.
* Familiarity with adult learning theories, instructional design, and leadership development best practices.
* Proven experience designing and executing successful learning strategies in an midsize or enterprise environment.
* Strong presentation and facilitation skills.
* Proficient in the use of Learning Management Systems (LMS) and digital learning tools.
* Expertise in leading change management and organizational effectiveness initiatives.
* Ability to leverage data analytics to measure program effectiveness and drive improvements.

At **Integris**, we value our team members and offer **comprehensive benefits**, including:


* Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* 401K Retirement Plan
* Minimum 4 Weeks of Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Birthday PTO
* Paid Holidays
* Paid Time Off for Volunteering
* Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Insurance
* Life Insurance
* Supplemental Insurance

Employee Assistance Program  
* 

**Join us in shaping the future of IT services while making a positive impact on our clients and communities.**


*Integris is an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, familial status, disability, genetic information, or any other protected class under applicable federal, state, and local laws.*

title: Front Desk Medical Receptionist
description:
**Company Overview**

**Positions available:**

**Denville, Lake Hopatcong, Landing, Rockaway Rheumatology and Rockaway ENT**

At Consensus Health, we believe better healthcare begins with a community of strong, independent providers delivering high quality, compassionate patient care with improved outcomes. As New Jersey’s fasting growing independent medical group, Consensus Health offers full clinical and operational integration with our value-based care programs, enabling providers to transform the healthcare delivery experience. In addition, Consensus Health owns and manages New Jersey’s oldest Independent Physician Association (“IPA”) with over 1,000 providers throughout the state. At Consensus Health we believe in fostering an environment of collaboration, participation, and respect. A cornerstone of that belief is a commitment to attracting talented and dedicated team members who work together for the common purpose of providing clinical excellence.

Consensus is committed to attracting, developing, and retaining talented people who are passionate about helping physicians and their staff deliver better care to patients and whose values align with ours. We empower our employees to bring the right solutions forward to strengthen the relationship between providers and patients and ensure that our staff are well served.

**Position Summary**

Performs a variety of front desk activities (answering phones/greeting patients) that support the Center and professional staff and performs a variety of essential services (checking-in, checking-out, etc.) as directed or requested by Practice Manager.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

The duties include, but are not limited to:

* Assist with/complete all Front Desk operations and the use of the Practice Management system to ensure efficient patient registration and check out processes.
* Greeting patients and verifying/inputting demographic information into Practice management system.
* Collecting and inputting all valid licenses and insurance information.
* Collecting and posting all co-payments and payments made at time of service.
* Maintaining/organizing patient documents/files
* Answering phones, scheduling appointments, taking messages
* Reconciling co-pays and time of service payments collected daily
* Filing/labeling/sending outbound and inbound faxes
* Maintain confidentiality and use discretion when handling patient’s medical records and information.
* May perform charge entry process.
* Completing referrals for a specialist
* Prior authorization requests from patients and/or providers
* Filing any/all paper
* Rooming patients when checked in and provider is ready to treat the patient
* Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned {keep this for all}

**Qualifications or Education, Training and Experience**

* High School graduate or equivalent. Computer literacy required.
* 1-2 years of previous customer service/data entry, administrative/office management/clerical experience required.
* Experience of working in the health or other public sector organization helpful, but not necessary.

**Knowledge and Skills/Expected Competencies**

* Business office procedures
* Grammar, spelling, punctuation, and basic arithmetic
* Medical insurance and medical billing skills
* Operating all office equipment
* Strong organizational and leadership skills
* Answering the telephone in a pleasant and helpful manner and using a multi-line telephone system.
* Establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with patients, employees, and the public.
* Speak clearly and concisely
* Read, understands, and follows oral and written instruction.
* Exceptional customer service skills
* Ability to sort and file materials correctly by alphabetic or numeric systems
* Ability and willingness to help patients with check in or check out process
* Work may require hand dexterity for telephone and office machine operation.
* Work may require sitting for long periods of time; also stooping, bending and stretching for files and supplies.
* Requires manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, operate a calculator, telephone, copier and such other office equipment as necessary.
* Hearing must be in the normal range for telephone contact.
* It is necessary to view computer screens for long periods and to work in an environment that may be stressful

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.71 - $22.53 per hour

Expected hours: 34 – 40 per week

Medical Specialty:

* Primary Care

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* What are your salary expectations in this role?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* Customer service: 2 years (Required)
* healthcare: 1 year (Required)
* Medical office: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person
company_description: At Consensus Health, we believe better healthcare begins with a community of strong, independent providers delivering high quality, compassionate patient care with improved outcomes.

title: Night Janitor Team Lead
description:
Calling all neat freaks! **New Beginning Cleaners** in **Brooklyn, NY** is hiring a **part-time Night Janitor Team Lead**. This position earns a competitive wage of **$18 to $19 per hour** and enjoys great benefits such as **dental, vision, paid time off, bonuses, incentives, accident, hospital, critical illness, and disability**.

**NEW BEGINNING CLEANERS: OUR STORY**


New Beginning Cleaners is a one-stop shop that efficiently provides residential, commercial, and post-construction cleaning services. We commit ourselves to continuing customer satisfaction, demonstrating integrity, and staying up to date on the latest products and equipment. Our mission is to provide our clients with top-notch services that improve their quality of life in their homes and workspaces. We want every customer to have a space that is clean, healthy, and allows them a new beginning!


Our team is thorough, driven, and committed. In return, we treat our employees with the utmost respect as well as reward their efforts. In addition to our **robust benefits and perks**, we take pride in our **open communication style and team-oriented environment.**

**WHAT IT'S LIKE TO BE A NIGHT JANITOR TEAM LEAD AT NEW BEGINNING CLEANERS**


As our new part-time Night Janitor Team Lead, you're kind of a big deal on our night shift team. You're the go-to person for making sure our cleaners have all the right tools and products they need for the job. Plus, you're always ready to jump in and show them the ropes if they need a little extra guidance.


And let's talk about your attention to detail. You've got eagle eyes when it comes to making sure our work meets our high-quality standards. You're like a cleaning ninja, inspecting everything with precision before giving it the green light.


We're not just blowing smoke, either. Your on-site experience is invaluable when it comes to creating field reports, janitorial checklists, and new policies for keeping things spick-and-span and safe. And let's not forget about your positive attitude! You're like a ray of sunshine, always motivating your team and ready to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty.


Basically, you're a rockstar leader who gets satisfaction from working with an amazing team and developing your skills!


The expected schedule for this part-time janitorial position is the **night shift** between the hours of **7:30 PM and 12:30 AM**.

**DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?**


Do you have excellent verbal and written communication skills? Are you reliable and independent? Can you thrive in a high-pressure, unpredictable environment? Do you enjoy working with a team? If yes, you might just be perfect for this part-time janitorial position!


The knowledge and skills required for the position are:

* Previous cleaning experience
* Previous supervisory experience
* Bilingual in English and Spanish
* Thorough knowledge of residential and commercial cleaning services
* Familiarity with Microsoft Office suite
* Valid driver's license and a good driving record


The ability to use your own car would be a plus!

**CONNECT WITH OUR JANITORIAL TEAM TODAY!**


If you think this Night Janitor Team Lead role will suit your needs, great! Applying is a piece of cake. You can finish the entire application in less than three minutes. Good luck - we're excited to meet you!

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
**Job Title:** Customer Success Manager  



  

**Location:** New Jersey, United States (Hybrid)  



  

**About BringOz:**

  

BringOz is a cloud-based end-to-end software solution to manage delivery, distribution and related services for global operations. Our mission is to transform how companies deliver services and goods by seamlessly bridging digital and physical interactions, improving experiences and productivity for consumers and stakeholders alike. As a Customer Success Manager, you will play a critical role in this transformation, empowering our clients to optimize and elevate their delivery processes through our innovative platform  



  

**Job Overview:**

  

BringOz is growing and is looking for a talented individual with a wide skill set to join our customer success team.  



  

As a CSM at BringOz, you will manage enterprise & mid market accounts, guiding and supporting them through their journey with our software solution. Your role will be pivotal in in uncovering the customer’s flow and needs, configuring the software to address them and maximizing the value they derive from various tools and capabilities. We are seeking a proactive, customer-oriented individual with a technical background in SaaS solutions, ready to lead our clients towards optimal use of our platform.


You will be the primary point of contact for the customer, ensuring their needs and feedback are directly addressed to maintain and enhance satisfaction and retention.


This role includes various degrees of remote support with times of extensive travel to the customers’ locations in order to achieve targets and goals.  



  

As a customer-focused company, the BringOz CSM role requires a blend of technical know-how, customer advocacy, and business acumen to ensure clients receive the highest level of service.  



  

**Key Responsibilities:**

  

* Develop and maintain strong relationships with enterprise & mid market customers, understanding their business needs and challenges.
* Plan and create a detailed customer journey tailored to the customer, ensuring a seamless experience at every stage.
* Act as the primary point of contact for your accounts and as Tier1 & 2 Support, ensuring a seamless customer experience.
* Conduct onboarding and training sessions tailored to the customer’s needs to maximize their understanding and effective use of the platform.
* Develop customized training materials and documentation specific to their use-cases.
* Work closely with the T1 CS team and serve as the primary liaison between the customer and our internal teams, ensuring that all issues, requests, and feedback are promptly addressed.
* Hold regular strategy meetings with internal and external stakeholders to ensure ongoing satisfaction and to identify potential areas for further service and expansion.
* Manage and report on key success metrics for the accounts, including user engagement, retention, overall health score, NPS, qualitative customer feedback, CES, CSAT and more
Travel to customer locations in the US for onboarding, meetings with stakeholders or launch of a new site.  
* 

  

**Desired Experience, Qualifications, Skills** :  



  

* At least 2 years of experience in customer success within a SaaS environment, preferably focused on enterprise accounts.
* Tech-savvy with a solid understanding of SaaS solutions (non-coding aspects).
* Prior experience with CRM tools is essential
* Familiarity with WMS, OMS, or TMS systems is an advantage.
* Advantage - Prior experience as an account manager
* Advantage - Experience working in a CPG or logistics companies
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
* Knowledge of Spanish or other languages is a plus.
* Ability to work remotely and adhere to a 8:00 to 17:00 Eastern Standard Time, Monday to Friday.
Travel may be required  
* 

  

**Company Culture and Values:**

  

At BringOz, we are committed to providing exceptional care for our customers and fostering a nurturing environment for our employees. Our culture is built on the belief in the potential of our people to grow and succeed within the organization.
